title: Every Cookbook Our Baking Club Has Baked Through
description: Months after we launched our Food52 Cookbook Club as a Facebook Group in 2017, our club moderator Linsey Sowa realized our pastry, pie, cake, bread, and cookie-loving members wanted a place to go deep on baking. So we began a dedicated Food52 Baking Club that followed the same rules. Together, we’ve cooked through nearly 100 cookbooks together. To make the titles easy to find for our new and current members—over 32,000 and counting!—we're listing them here for easy access and inspo. Read More >>
author: Food52
excerpt: Food52's Baking Club has cooked through nearly 100 books—and counting—since it launched in 2017. Use this list of all the titles we've covered for inspo and to bake from during our "Throwback" months and "Throwback Thursdays."
text: Months after we launched our Food52 Cookbook Club as a Facebook Group in 2017, our club moderator Linsey Sowa realized our pastry, pie, cake, bread, and cookie-loving members wanted a place to go deep on baking. So we began a dedicated Food52 Baking Club that followed the same rules. Together, we’ve cooked through nearly 100 cookbooks together. To make the titles easy to find for our new and current members—over 32,000 and counting!—we're listing them here for easy access and inspo. The way our members bake together across continents and time zones is simple: We post pics and reviews of the recipes we make from one of our chosen books. This could mean our “Book of the Month,” our annual “Bonus Book,” or any past cookbook we've covered for a Throwback Thursday or Throwback Month (August and February) post. Even if you can’t get your hands on your own copy, we make sure you can still cook along with us, by excerpting recipes from our chosen cookbooks and only selecting titles that you can also download to a device. Follow us on Instagram at @f52cookbookclub, and join the Baking Club here, and check out our Cookbook Club, too, along with every book they've cooked through. Below is the full list of cookbooks our club has covered—plus the titles we’re baking through next. You can also see the entire list of books (and search the recipe indexes) on Eat Your Books here. Sign up for free to access it—to organize and build your own shelf, get your first month free with code FOOD5224. Bonus Book: Sift: The Elements of Great Baking by Nicola Lamb January: Still We Rise: A Love Letter to the Southern Biscuit with Over 70 Sweet and Savory Recipes by Erika Council February: Happy Birthday Cookbook + Baking Clubs! All previously covered books are fair game. March: The King Arthur Baking Company Big Book of Bread: 125+ Recipes for Every Baker by King Arthur Baking Company Bonus Book: The Pie & Pastry Bible by Rose Levy Beranbaum January: The Cookie That Changed My Life: and More Than 100 Other Classic Cakes Cookies Muffins and Pies That Will Change Yours: A Cookbook by Nancy Silverton February: Happy 7th Birthday Cookbook Clubs! All previously covered books are fair game. html:
Months after we launched our Food52 Cookbook Club as a Facebook Group in 2017, our club moderator Linsey Sowa realized our pastry, pie, cake, bread, and cookie-loving members wanted a place to go deep on baking. So we began a dedicated Food52 Baking Club that followed the same rules.

Together, we’ve cooked through nearly 100 cookbooks together. To make the titles easy to find for our new and current members—over 32,000 and counting!—we're listing them here for easy access and inspo.

The way our members bake together across continents and time zones is simple: We post pics and reviews of the recipes we make from one of our chosen books. This could mean our “Book of the Month,” our annual “Bonus Book,” or any past cookbook we've covered for a Throwback Thursday or Throwback Month (August and February) post. Even if you can’t get your hands on your own copy, we make sure you can still cook along with us, by excerpting recipes from our chosen cookbooks and only selecting titles that you can also download to a device.

Follow us on Instagram at @f52cookbookclub, and join the Baking Club here, and check out our Cookbook Club, too, along with every book they've cooked through.

Below is the full list of cookbooks our club has covered—plus the titles we’re baking through next. You can also see the entire list of books (and search the recipe indexes) on Eat Your Books here. Sign up for free to access it—to organize and build your own shelf, get your first month free with code FOOD5224.
